title: No chat restrictions, Level 5 honor - 14 day ban for trolling in chat for 1 normal game???
body:
I'm confused? Are any Rioters able to clarify if this is a bug? It was instantly after the game finished too so it was clearly an automated thing rather than a case review of some kind.

I could understand a chat restriction but I was even clearly sarcastic with most of my trolling: such as telling the support to sell all their items and buy a sightstone or I'll afk (which I'd do for everything, despite playing seriously the whole game?).

Just seems hugely blown out of proportion considering I am even Honour 5, have no punishments before hand, and it being a normal game.

replies.body:
> I'm confused? Are any Rioters able to clarify if this is a bug?

This is not a bug, you were caught by the instant feedback system for zero tolerance (hate speech, death threats, etc)

> It was instantly after the game finished too so it was clearly an automated thing rather than a case review of some kind.

That is 100% correct. The automated system picked up this behavior right after the game finished.

> I could understand a chat restriction but I was even clearly sarcastic with most of my trolling

Zero tolerance is a special area that automatically escalates your penalty; it will always result in either a 14-day ban or permanent ban depending on the severity.

We take this type of behavior extremely seriously. Telling people to kill themselves and hate speech are big no-no's. A simple litmus test is, what would happen if you walked up to a stranger and repeated your chat?

So, with this comment as back-up, every single game I see the letters "f g t" typed  you will hand out an instant 14 day ban. Good to know.

I literally have a person on my fl who uses the n word fully fleshed out and hateful and nothing has happened, its silly really. Yet I get instant banned despite no previous offences when there is a chat restriction punishment for exactly this situation. If there was consistency people would know that you will completely skip the chat restriction phase for 3 letters instead of actual hate speech is all I'm saying.

>  If there was consistency people would know that you will completely skip the chat restriction phase for 3 letters instead of actual hate speech is all I'm saying.

It is a machine, it is consistent. If your friend typed the exact same chat you did, they would be penalized in the exact same way as you. If you friend does indeed use hate speech, and get reported, it will end up the same for them.

"We'll turn a blind eye and let you continue giving us money but if someone reports then we have to peacock" is the vibe this system gives.

AFAIK, it is so that the users can help determine what the system considers negative/toxic behaviour.

Different countries, regions and cultures have different behavioural values and the system needs to account for them properly.

For example, calling a player a "c*nt" may be treated differently on the OCE server than on the NA server because they adhere to different cultural standards.
In my country calling someone a %%% lost most of its meaning. When you say it to someone it means more like, you did something bad. On the internet the word %%% lost a lot of it's meaning too...
